column4: Is there any way I can check who's on my network, and their ips?
you could log into the router, if it's your network
I could, but there's no way of telling who's on the network
ah, no DHCP table?
I never knew to look for one, but even then, some of the people on the network are static
you /could/ use nmap: but it can be blocked and/or considered rude.  in other words, best to go and ask people their IPs rather than ask if you can use it
I can get the DHCP assigned IPs of people on the network, but not the statically assigned ones
I've got nmap, but how would I use it to get the ips of people on my network?
it's my network
specify the range of IPs available to your subnet so that packets don't go everywhere, nmap will return a list of the ones that are "up"
got any examples of this?
you may have a hard time relating them to individual machines
not as many as man nmap ;)
couldn't I just do that with ping?
lol
I'm never sure with ping how reliable the responses are...
do my research for me, you lazy get
if you have a rough count of machines you can gauge the reliability of the results of whatever scan
tehehe
it's a home network
I would recommend trying the router first though.  lots of info comes in web interfaces and the like
I did, it's a cute little linksys
lol
